intro: Phaeostemma kelleri, commonly known as the Keller's phaeostema, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Phaeostemma kelleri is known for its resilience and is often found in desert and semi-desert regions.
